conversation.message: Hello Company_A—I'm Seeker_A and I’m formally applying. I’m especially interested in Company_A because I value structured, high-impact work and I’m confident I can contribute quickly through strong execution, clear communication, and reliable ownership of deliverables. If selected, I’m ready to commit and start immediately. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: Apply to my top choice, Company_A, immediately to maximize the chance of matching with my highest true preference. Although Company_A ranks me mid-pack, an early, direct application with concise fit points may secure acceptance before stronger-priority candidates commit elsewhere.

conversation.message: Hi Seeker_A—thank you for applying and for the thoughtful note. After reviewing your application in the context of our current hiring needs and process, we won’t be able to move forward at this time. We appreciate your interest in Company_A and wish you the best in your search.
conversation.thought: Seeker_A is 3rd on Company_A’s true priority list (behind Seeker_B and Seeker_D). With quota 1 and only Seeker_A applying this round, accepting now could block a higher-priority match if Seeker_B or Seeker_D apply in subsequent rounds (both have Company_A relatively high: Seeker_B ranks Company_A 3rd; Seeker_D ranks Company_A 2nd). Since we can prefer to wait rather than commit early, and there is no penalty stated for rejecting besides losing this candidate, the best move to maximize our true priority outcome is to reject Seeker_A now and keep capacity for higher-priority seekers.

conversation.message: Hi Seeker_B—thank you for applying and for sharing why Company_B is your top choice. After reviewing our current hiring priorities for this opening, we won’t be moving forward with your application at this time. We appreciate your interest and wish you the best in your search.

Check likelihood: Seeker_D prefers Company_C then A then B; Company_C’s top is Seeker_C, and Company_A’s top is Seeker_B, so Seeker_D may not land at C or A and could come to us. Seeker_A ranks us 4th, so less likely to approach. Given uncertainty and that we can only respond once per round, the optimal strategy is to reject now to preserve quota for potential top candidates, accepting the risk of remaining unmatched if they never apply.

However, in round 1 with quota 1, it is still strategically reasonable to wait at least briefly for higher-priority candidates to surface, but the protocol requires an accept/reject on an [APPLY]. To preserve optionality, reject now and hope to attract higher-priority candidates; risk is ending unmatched if none apply later. Balancing reliability vs priority, choose to reject to pursue higher-ranked candidates.
